title: Instructional Design for Addition and Subtraction Concept Understanding for Students with ADHD: PMRI Approach-Based

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and foundational awareness of ADHD student characteristics
context.additional_context: Enhancing instructional design competencies for current practitioners (educators, special education specialists, etc.) to support math concept learning for students with ADHD.

learning_goals: Enhancing the Ability to Design Addition and Subtraction Learning Activities for Students with ADHD Using the PMRI Approach

Within a mid-term course (three weeks), learners develop a checklist-based tool with at least ten items to assess ADHD students’ conceptual understanding indicators (classification, mathematical representation, problem-solving application), achieving at least 80% suitability in expert review

Learners create three interactive learning materials related to mathematical concepts (e.g., functions, geometry) using digital tools like GeoGebra or Desmos, conduct usability testing with at least five colleagues, and submit improvement plans reflecting feedback

resources: Case studies on ADHD student learning

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
